thread.title: Goldman Sachs downgrades Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) to a Hold
thread.title_full: Goldman Sachs downgrades Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) to a Hold

author: Tipranks
title: Goldman Sachs downgrades Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) to a Hold
text:
Goldman Sachs downgrades Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) to a Hold
Advanced Micro Devices ([AMD](https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/amd?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral) – [Research Report](https://www.tipranks.com/subscribe/research-report/?symbol=amd&ref=MCO_STOCK&refersTo=&merge=Markets&utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral)) received a Hold rating and price target from Goldman Sachs analyst [Toshiya Hari](https://www.tipranks.com/experts/analysts/toshiya-hari?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral) yesterday. The company’s shares closed last Wednesday at $121.84.

[Top Smart Score Stocks](https://www.tipranks.com/screener/top-smart-score-stocks?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral) - Filter, analyze, and streamline your search for investment opportunities using
[Tipranks' Stock Screener](https://www.tipranks.com/screener/stocks?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral)
According to [TipRanks](https://www.tipranks.com?ref=investing.com&utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral), Hari is a top 100 analyst with an average return of 28.8% and a 66.33% success rate. Hari covers the Technology sector, focusing on stocks such as Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices, and Analog Devices.
Advanced Micro Devices has an analyst consensus of Moderate Buy, with a price target consensus of $182.20.
AMD market cap is currently $197.7B and has a P/E ratio of 108.99.
Based on the recent corporate insider activity of 77 insiders, corporate insider sentiment is negative on the stock. This means that over the past quarter there has been an increase of insiders selling their shares of AMD in relation to earlier this year. Most recently, in November 2024, Forrest Eugene Norrod, the EVP & GM DESG of AMD sold 40,540.00 shares for a total of $5,743,301.80.

Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Company Description:
Founded in 1969, California-based Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is America’s leading [semiconductor](https://www.tipranks.com/compare-stocks/chips-stocks?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral) company. The Computing and Graphics segment includes desktop and notebook processors and chipsets, discrete and integrated graphics processing units, data center and professional GPUs and development services. The Enterprise, Embedded and Semi-Custom segment includes server and embedded processors, semi-custom System-on-Chip products, development services and technology for game consoles.
